title: Help with identity of font in logo?
content:
I’ve assumed responsibility for maintaing a website that another developer created. The problem is that this developer never left any files or information regarding the fonts that he used when he initially developed the website.

Anyone care to lend me a hand and try to identify the font that was used in [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110035220/http:/www.bearslax.com/images/system/cla_logo_large.gif) logo?

Thanks in advance - I really appreciate your help…

- Al Liebowitz
author: liebowa

comments.content: The site you linked to _( bearslax.com )_, doesnt seem to work..

That’s odd - It works for me. Both the website ( [http://www.bearslax.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110035220/http:/www.bearslax.com/)) and the link I posted above directly to the graphic work here.

I’ll call around and see if others are having problems. What error are you getting?

Thanks!

Yea, thats odd, as it seems to work now..  
_( Edit-a-bit.: I am almost sure that this is an [Iconian](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110035220/http:/www.iconian.com/) font.. )_

That was a good suggestion Dav, but the closest font there was [Gunship](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110035220/http:/www.iconian.com/g.html), and it wasn’t the same in many ways.

_(I’ve also checked MyFonts ‘Techno’ & ‘Futuristic’ styles. Also looked at parts of DaFont’s Techno styles. I suggested Typophile to Al, because I was getting nowhere, and thought someone here might recognize the font(s) used. I think the angled A might be a customization to make this more logo-ish, since it’s an easy three straight lines to make.)_

- Mike Yanega

It is.. _Niiice find, Stefan_..

‘ [Steel Wolf](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110035220/http:/www.tlai.com/med_des/scifi.html)’, _by Tom C Lai_..
